alert.note: Alert for Adair; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 5:13PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Sequoyah and south central Adair Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 513 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 3 miles east of Brushy, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Muldrow... Roland... Brushy... Dora... Cottonwood... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 317 and 328. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Arkansas...and northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
